file_insights.purpose: Comprehensive A/B testing framework documentation for TikTok content creation
key_sections: Test Variables (Hooks, Script, CTA, Visual Style, Captions)
A/B Testing Methodology with Golden Rule
file_insights.content_depth: Enterprise-grade testing framework with actionable guidance

file_insights.purpose: Template variants for A/B testing across hook types, script structures, and CTAs
file_insights.status: Created but content truncated in diff output

patterns_discovered.description: Implementation follows rigorous scientific method: hypothesis definition, single-variable isolation, controlled conditions, 7-day observation windows, 20% threshold for significance
patterns_discovered.significance: HIGH - Ensures reliable, data-driven decision making

patterns_discovered.description: Framework categorizes all testable elements (hooks, script structure, CTAs, visuals, captions) with impact levels (HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW), enabling prioritized testing roadmap
Three-level progression (Beginner→Intermediate→Advanced) with clear metrics for each level (test frequency, save rate improvements of 15-50%+)
patterns_discovered.significance: MEDIUM - Helps users self-assess capability and plan scaling

patterns_discovered.description: Extensive 'Common Mistakes' table and pre-execution checklist prevent methodological flaws that invalidate tests
Framework explicitly ties to Content Calendar and Performance Tracker with specific posting models (3x/week, 5x/week), maintaining consistency while testing
patterns_discovered.significance: MEDIUM - Ensures practical implementation without operational disruption

patterns_discovered.description: Clear mapping between test type and primary metric (hooks→save rate, length→completion rate, CTAs→profile visits), removing ambiguity

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Single-variable isolation is critical but non-obvious
gotchas_discovered.detail: Framework explicitly warns against testing multiple variables simultaneously (hook + script + CTA together) as this obscures causality. Many content creators naturally batch changes.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Framework provides 'Golden Rule' section with explicit DO/DON'T examples

gotchas_discovered.detail: TikTok's algorithm continues pushing content for 7+ days. Results after 24 hours appear conclusive but are actually noise. Framework mandates 7-day minimum.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Explicit requirement stated multiple times with scientific justification

gotchas_discovered.detail: Testing Tuesday 6pm vs. Wednesday 9am introduces confounding variables. Both variants must be posted at same time on same day-of-week.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Framework specifies posting schedule requirements and checklist

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: 20% improvement threshold needed for statistical confidence
gotchas_discovered.detail: Smaller performance differences (<10%) are likely random variance. Framework requires 20%+ to declare winner, which many creators would treat as success.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Threshold is documented with rationale; options provided for inconclusive results

gotchas_discovered.detail: Framework notes that small accounts (<1000 views/video) have insufficient data for reliable A/B testing. Creates barrier for emerging creators.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Documented as limitation; progression model acknowledges this growth requirement

gotchas_discovered.detail: Viral trends, holidays, platform algorithm changes during test window can skew results. Framework mentions but doesn't provide robust mitigation.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Checklist includes noting external factors; suggestion to retest if factors present

framework_characteristics.comprehensiveness: Enterprise-grade - covers philosophy, methodology, common mistakes, integration, tracking, and maturity progression
framework_characteristics.actionability: High - includes specific templates, checklists, decision trees, posting schedules, and spreadsheet schemas
framework_characteristics.research_depth: Substantial - references scientific method, statistical confidence, sample size considerations, and iterative testing patterns
framework_characteristics.user_maturity_consideration: Yes - three-level maturity model (Beginner/Intermediate/Advanced) with expectations at each level

approach_outcome.framework_structure: Linear progression from philosophy → rationale → variables → methodology → execution → analysis → calendar integration → error prevention
approach_outcome.primary_value_proposition: Removes guesswork from content optimization by establishing systematic, data-driven A/B testing discipline with 20%+ performance improvement as target
approach_outcome.estimated_implementation_time: 30 days minimum for basic proficiency (first quick-start plan), 3-12 months for advanced multivariate capability

recommendations.rationale: Framework mandates 7 days and 20% threshold but doesn't help creators calculate minimum views needed for different confidence intervals. Adding simple calculator would improve precision.

recommendations.recommendation: Create hypothesis template library with examples
recommendations.rationale: Framework shows format ('I believe [X] will increase [Y] because [Z]') but variant-templates.md appears truncated. Extensive hypothesis examples would reduce user uncertainty.

recommendations.recommendation: Develop external factors taxonomy and mitigation strategies
recommendations.rationale: Framework acknowledges viral trends/holidays can invalidate tests but offers limited guidance. Structured approach (e.g., 'if trending during test, extend by 3 days') would reduce invalid results.

recommendations.recommendation: Create branching decision tree for inconclusive results
recommendations.rationale: Framework offers Option 1 (retest) and Option 2 (more extreme variation) but doesn't guide which to choose. Decision tree based on context would improve troubleshooting.

recommendations.recommendation: Add sample performance benchmarks by account size
recommendations.rationale: Framework defines success metrics (2.99% vs 4.20% save rate) but these may differ significantly for micro vs established accounts. Benchmarks by follower tier would enable better expectation-setting.
Framework tests internal variables but doesn't address competitor benchmarking. Integration point would enable context ('our 4.2% save rate vs competitor 5.8%').

recommendations.recommendation: Create regression testing protocol for proven winners
recommendations.rationale: Framework documents what wins but not how to verify winners remain optimal as audience/platform evolves. Periodic regression testing (quarterly?) would catch drift.
